title: How to write attention-grabbing headlines - Writing & Blogging - Quora

response.answer_text: Know your audience. The first thing any writer should realize is that their words will not grab the attention of everyone. You can look at software that analyses content, word strength and a dozen other specifics. None of that will tell you about your audience. I often get asked questions on Quora. Over fifty percent of the time I don’t have an answer or my answer wouldn’t adjust to my “audience,” because I don’t hold the expertise to write on the subject - for that audience. I pass. There are of course ways around this problem. You can study your audience, know their prejudices or likes and attempt to put yourself in their place. After a bit, depending on what the headlines are for your audience will seek you out.
Left 10 Dummies to write a headline, and six are now in the hospital! Start with what they think will happen, then BAM! Show’em what crazy junk you know and they just gotta find out.
When trying to write a catchy headline, try as much as possible not to make it lengthy. Also, use software like headline analyzer to see how your headline score. Follow back if this is helpful
